snippet: The release of the capital controls will be watched carefully as an important case study in how to manage a crisis.
abstract: Icelandic government unveils plan to remove capital controls, imposed at height of banking crisis, in way that limits possibility of large outflow of assets that could destabilize currency; Iceland's long period of capital controls has been praised by economists for successfully managing tumult after its major three banks collapsed in 2008, but new plan will test whether this strategy was ultimately successful.

byline.original: By JENNY ANDERSON and CHAD BRAY
byline.contributor: Jenny Anderson reported from Reykjavik, Iceland, and Chad Bray from London.

lead_paragraph: The release of the capital controls will be watched carefully as an important case study in how to manage a crisis.

headline.main: Iceland to Lift Capital Controls Imposed After Financial Crisis
headline.print_headline: Iceland Starts to Lift Emergency Measures
